    • Constructor Detail

      • EditTransaction

        public EditTransaction​(Book book,
                       Account account,
                       Transaction original)
        The three-arg constructor needs all the information to edit details about a transaction:
        Parameters:
        book - what book it's recorded in
        account - what account's ledger the edit was called from
        original - what transaction is being edited

    • Method Detail

      • setAccountChoices

        public void setAccountChoices()
        internal method to set up the options in the ComboBox on the GUI

      • edit

        public Transaction edit()
        A new Transaction object is created with the values input into the EditTransactionGUI.fxml form, and replaces an old transaction
        Returns:
        Transaction the updated (edited) transaction details

      • editTransfer

        public void editTransfer​(Account transfer,
                         boolean notNormal,
                         int ledgerID)
        Edits details into the other account used to balance the books, if necessary deletes the old balance transfer and creates a new one (i.e. the transfer column was edited)
        Parameters:
        transfer - The account used to balance the books with this transaction
        notNormal - Balance means the values are automatically the opposite of the original transaction's debit/credit status
        ledgerID - The background ID the computer uses to track the transactions --different than the human readable transactionID that shows on the ledger
